text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/98945560c1ae6e2ddee820a7de718a36e3f4b6e5|patch 8.2.1540: the user cannot try out emoji character widths>
patch 8.2.1540: the user cannot try out emoji character widths

Problem:    The user cannot try out emoji character widths.
Solution:   Move the emoji script to the runtime/tools directory.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1540: the user cannot try out emoji character widths · vim/vim@9894556
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1540: the user cannot try out emoji character widths · vim/vim@9894556
attachments.text: Problem: The user cannot try out emoji character widths. Solution: Move the emoji script to the runtime/tools directory.

patch 8.2.1539: using invalid script ID causes a crash

Problem:    Using invalid script ID causes a crash.
Solution:   Check the script ID to be valid. (closes #6804)

patch 8.2.1538: Python: iteration over vim objects fails to keep reference

Problem:    Python: iteration over vim objects fails to keep reference.
Solution:   Keep a reference for the object. (Paul Ollis, closes #6803,
            closes #6806)

Solution:   Use array and pointers correctly.

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4e4473c927167fd24e5c8df90e0e8035080cf2da|patch 8.2.1536: cannot get the class of a character; emoji widths are…>
patch 8.2.1536: cannot get the class of a character; emoji widths are wrong

Problem:    Cannot get the class of a character; emoji widths are wrong in
            some environments.
Solution:   Add charclass(). Update some emoji widths.  Add script to check
            emoji widths.

patch 8.2.1535: it is not possible to specify cell widths of characters

Problem:    It is not possible to specify cell widths of characters.
Solution:   Add setcellwidths().

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ee8580e52e767916e2a95e8ac0732fd8a5ae0651|patch 8.2.1534: Vim9: type error for argument type is not at call pos…>
patch 8.2.1534: Vim9: type error for argument type is not at call position

Problem:    Vim9: type error for argument type is not at call position.
Solution:   Set the context and stack after checking the arguments.
            (issue #6785)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1534: Vim9: type error for argument type is not at call pos… · vim/vim@ee8580e

attachments.text: …ition Problem: Vim9: type error for argument type is not at call position. Solution: Set the context and stack after checking the arguments. (issue #6785)
